text: I have a really easy summer recipe for
you it's smokey baby back ribs and
everything is made in the oven no grill
required to start off with them making a
delicious rub I have a half a cup of
dark brown sugar in this bowl and to
that I'm adding 1/3 of a cup of coarse
salt this is a really easy recipe for a
rub that's great on a lot of different
things and I'm making about double the
amount I'm going to need here this is a
quarter cup of Cajun seasoning and then
three tablespoons of sweet paprika don't
use the smoky stuff that would be
completely overwhelming a teaspoon of
freshly ground black pepper and then a
teaspoon and a half of mustard powder
ground dried mustard and the same amount
of cayenne a teaspoon and a half stir it
together and you have your delicious
smoky well the rubs out that smoky I'm
going to make a smoky barbecue sauce
later when I finish my ribs off put
about half of the spice rub away for
later make sure that you label it you
know what it is you don't want to look
in your in your pantry later in the
summer and say what is that stuff what
am i I'm just gonna get rid of it no
don't do that
label it date it then you'll always know
what you have on hand put it in your
pantry for later date over here I have
two racks of baby back ribs sometimes
when you buy ribs the membrane that's on
the back of the ribs that sort of holds
them together has been removed and
sometimes it hasn't and you kind of want
to remove it because as they cook the
membrane won't break down and it will
give the illusion that the ribs are kind
of tough because it'll hold everything
together when they're really cooked so
you want to remove that if you can or
maybe your butcher has removed it I like
to just loosen it and get my fingers
underneath the membrane here and then if
you use a piece of paper towel you can
grab onto it and just pull it off all in
one piece so just grab onto it you see
how it's lifting up and there's this
membrane like that now you can just pull
the whole thing off oh it should pull
off but I think it's separated at the
point so I'll pull it off in two pieces
that's okay too
or like 16 pieces it worked so well when
I did it before basically you're just
trying to remove that membrane if it
comes off all in one piece lucky you if
it doesn't well you're just like me
you guys were more than one way to skin
a rack I'm just using the tip of my
knife to sort of get underneath the very
end of the membrane and now I'm pulling
it now this is actually coming off much
better see if you get it right and it's
not it's actually kind of fun when it
works tada
now the membrane has been removed you
can get rid of that and now your ribs
are ready to rub lay each rack
individually on a piece of parchment
line file and then rub half of the
remaining rub over each rack and
remember all that cayenne pepper in the

it and make your eyes hurt really what
you're looking to do is just get a

ha ready to move on alright
now all you need to do is wrap your ribs
up make sure that your oven is
preheating to 200 degrees when you want
to start cooking these because that's
the temp you need to cook them at you're
gonna cook them low and slow for about
two and a half hours and until they're
tender put them on a baking sheet these
rips are gonna need to bake for about
two and a half hours at 200 degrees just
until they're tender when your ribs are
almost done make a smoky barbecue sauce
this is a really easy barbecue sauce I'm
using chili sauce as the base one cup of
chili sauce nothing like sriracha but
like a mild chili sauce more like a
spicy ketchup add that to a quarter cup
of chopped Chipotle's and adobo that's
where the smokiness and the name comes
from if you like a little bit less spice
to use less Chipotle in the glaze or
less cayenne pepper in the rub one or
the other or even both and two
tablespoons of honey and that's it very
very simple especially going to go well
with that spicy rub stir everything
together and then you can get your ribs
out of the oven and glaze them take ribs
out of the oven and turn the broiler on
you want to unwrap them get rid of the
foil and put them on your baking sheet
make sure your broiler is on now this
part you can actually do on the grill as
well so if you want to do it in the
broiler do it in the broiler if you want
to finish them on the grill it's a great
idea
spread your sauce over your ribs you can
do it on both sides if you want do the
first side then turn them over and do
the second side I'm going to do the bone
side then I'll turn it back over brush
the meat side again and then they go in
the under the broiler just until they're
bubbling and browned shouldn't take more
than a couple minutes
once they're nice and bubbly and
golden-brown you take them out eat them
that's all that's left to do it's gonna

they're sweet they're spicy they're
